intro: Scholtzia pentamera, commonly known as the five-petaled scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Scholtzia pentamera thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, making it a hardy plant in arid environments. Its unique botanical features make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
